creator: john.gunnarsson.x@sonyericsson.com
text:
Ant parses the classpath before running. 
ANT cannot handle a space in the classpath. It then throws an exception.
Personally I would like to put Ant in "Program Files" in order not to clog the 
c: with a lot of folders.

This took like 2h in order to look in your docs, the java docs, checking all 
other strange installations I recently made in order to run JDTS (a not too 
good tool from SUN).
It would be helpful if this information was added to the documentation if you 
are not going to fix this.

Have a nice day and happy coding!
John Gunnarsson, Sweden

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
Ant happily works with spaces in classpaths. We have put many years of effort
into tuning the startup scripts to deal with spaces in java_home, ant_home, etc,
etc,.

1. did you have a quote in your classpath or something like that? What is your
CLASSPATH, ANT_HOME, JAVA_HOME, PATH

2. platform? Not windows+cygwin, by any chance?

Hi there!
I managed to get all the things to work yesterday and now I cannot recreate 
the problem. The text feedback suggested that it was the classpath that was 
the source of the problem. It gave a part of the classpath in the error text, 
starting with " Files\SomeDir" for two different entries. Today there is no 
such output...

I tried to move Ant back to Program Files and that works fine. This is 
strange! I must have made some other change too that affected the classpath.
Perhaps I changed all the / for \. I know I did that for some of my settings...
I introduced 5 new environment settings yesterday due to the not so good JDTS.
The stupid JTWI package does not accept spaces in its environment variables, 
but ANT cannot be blamed for that. ****ing SUN programs... Grrr

Well, sorry for the inconveniance. I'll collect more data at the time when I 
have the problem for you next time.

Oh, I did not use cygwin if that still is of any interest.

Sincerily
John G
